intro: Nautilocalyx hirtiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-flowered nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its hairy inflorescences and distinctive floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
